{{Infobox person | name = Adele Givens | image = | image_size =
| birth_date = {{Birth date and age|mf=yes|1968|7|1}} | birth_place = [[Chicago, Illinois]], U.S. | nationality = [[United States|American]] | death_date = | death_place = | occupation = Actress, comedian, writer | years_active = 1989â€“present | website= [http://adelegivenstoo.com/ Official Website] }} '''Adele Givens''' (born '''Willadele Givens'''; July 1, 1968) is an [[United States|American]] [[actress]] and [[comedian]]. Her television appearances include ''[[The Hughleys]]'', ''[[Moesha]]'', ''[[The Parkers]]'', ''[[Comedy Central Presents]]'', ''[[Def Comedy Jam]]'', ''[[Russell Simmons Presents Def Poetry]]'', ''[[Martin (TV series)|Martin]]'', ''[[Tracey Takes On...]]'' and ''[[The Steve Harvey Show]]''. She currently lives in [[Lexington, Kentucky]].
==Career== Givens was the 1989 Grand Prize Winner of the Crown Royal Comedy Contest held at the [[New Regal Theater|Regal Theater]] in [[Chicago, Illinois]]. The next year, Givens was a finalist in the [[Miller Lite Comedy Search]], which was won by [[Bernie Mac]]. Her movie appearances include ''[[Beauty Shop]]'' and ''[[The Players Club]]''. Givens and fellow African American female comedians [[Mo'Nique]], [[Laura Hayes]] and [[Sommore]] were the stars of ''[[The Queens of Comedy]]'' tour, which was filmed and subsequently shown on [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]] and released on [[DVD]]. In 2001, she hosted ''[[The Source (magazine)|The Source]]'''s Hip Hip Awards Preshow which was shown on [[UPN]].
==References== *Anonymous. [http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1P3-1092037841.html "'Queen of Comedy' Adele Givens to perform at Funny Bone"] Call & Post. Call and Post Newspapers P-W Publishing. 2006. HighBeam Research. 16 Aug. 2009 <http://www.highbeam.com>.
